author: purple dragon studios
comment: here is an explanation of the story:    the male is the son of a yokai hunter. he helps his father hunt down a creature called a houligin ( i think thats how its spelled ) that transforms between a human and a fox like creature. everyone thinks houligins enchant men for evil witchcraft. the young male meets the houligins daughter who explains to him that isint right. and that once a mans heart is set on one of her kind the woman can always hear them no matter how far away and that her mother must meet him every night to keep him quiet. as the years go on. technology like trains is becoming much more common. the girl starts to slowly lose her power to return to her real form due to technology sapping magic from the world. the man ends up leaving china to go to england. learning technology and working on the trains keeping them running. learning about the world of technology. meanwhile the houligin girl ends up in england. bewitching men for money and good as she could no longer hunt back in china. one night one of her clients ends up drugging her. having scientists turn her into a cyborg as machines are the only thing that can arouse him. showing her off to others like himself with a sexual interest in machines. she ends up meeting her childhood friend and asks for his help and explains about how she ended up that way. she tells him her dream. to jump from rooftop to rooftop untill she is looking down on the entire city. to growl at those who think they can own her. he agrees to make her dream come true and he works night and day making plans. reshaping parts and slowly transforming her body. untill one night she is able to fully transform into her true form. fulfilling her dream and saving victims who may have met the same fate as her. turning into a cyborg.  i hope the explanation was ok this is what i remember from watching it so if its wrong let me know please

author: Little Fox
comment: For those curious and haven't seen the episode I'd love to explain what's going on in the video. (Spoilers)      The main male character is the son of a spirit hunter and the woman with him is the daughter of the kitsune his father killed in the beginning. The world changes quickly and the two grow close, people start to believe less in spirits and in so the woman loses her grip on her powers. Her body is torn away from her and she against her will is turned into a cyborg. The son faces race discrimination all the while trying to help his friend regain her powers through mechanical means. With his help she is able to shapeshift once again and swears revenge on the disgusting men who hurt her and others like her.  It's one of the better episodes of LDR, but all in all the whole season is amazing and I'd highly recommend it for mature audiences. (Keep in mind, the show has a fair bit of sexual activity, nudity & gore.)

author: Gi Gi
comment: @Howyaduing The whole point of the original story was holding on to what matters, keeping true to your nature. He makes things that are beautiful & expresses himself that way, she returned to her more wild nature at the end thanks to him. Neither should force themselves to change in order to fit in or have an easy life

author: Gi Gi

He was tied down to the workshop where he worked at his craft also- a trade off he accepted more willingly, but she would not.  Two people can have a strong relationship but still be too different to live together. It doesn‚Äôt make their bond any weaker

author: Starcatcher
comment: The spirit hunter taught his son that those fox-like creatures who can shapeshift into human women are very dangerous and must be killed, as they're known to seduce villagers so they can feed on them. However, the young girl tells him that it's actually the men who lust after them and who won't leave them alone until they get what they want. Her mother gets killed by the hunter, but the boy allows her to escape and they become friends.  (Spoilers) I guess the unambiguously bad people are those who abuse her after she loses the ability to change back to her true form, especially one sick client with some kind of robot fetish, who replaces most of her body parts with metal ones... Her friend helps her by making her a new robotic body that can turn her into a fox again.

author: Creations Maxo
comment: Well, it's more like an episode than a movie. It's on Netflix. It's a series of single episodes made by different studios (like Animatrix and Halo Legends) where each episode tell a story with, as main theme(s) 2 or 3 of the words in the title: Love, Death & Robots. This one is one of the few 2D key-framed animation in the lot. I highly recommend it, but I must warn anyone who want to watch it that it will leave you in a state where you'll be wishing for more. ;)

author: Area51Alien 1234
comment: Isn‚Äôt the whole Chinese culture of this episode kind of historically inaccurate  Don‚Äôt get me wrong steampunk cyborg robots is also inaccurate for the current time period but think for a second The father who hunts down these women of sorts is seen to be wearing a Yin Yang necklace but also using a Katana and kimono of sorts  Yin Yang is Chinese and Kimonos and katanas are Japanese  The Chinese had a Katana like weapon called the Miaodao which is like a Katana but more straight and longer with a less polished blade and different hilt  But the Father has a katana due to you seeing the traditional Japanese Katana hilt which isn‚Äôt seen on an Miaodao Overall good episode but crappy history reference

author: Enas Zaq
comment: For anyone curious, that lady who turns into a fox (or robo fox later on) is a Kitsune in Japanese folklore or a Jiuweihu in Chinese folklore. They are fox-spirits that can either be good or bad but both usually are portrayed as young beautiful women.

author: Lumorniel Sycamore
comment: @Canadian-Rain Oh for fuck's sake your first comment barely made any sense you didn't call me out you were questioning my right to comment on what he said and now you're all of a sudden talking about me insulting the guy. The insult I said wasn't even that bad and it was more meant to poke fun at his comment than to actually hurt him. Grow up instead of trying to play internet police. You have every right to call me out or whatever if that's what you wanna waste your time on but I'm not playing this game with you anymore.

author: Canadian-Rain
comment: @Lumorniel Sycamore My issue is that you decided to insult the guy. He's the one who made the comment he doesn't want to talk about the main story, and that's okay. He's not acting like a r/niceguy. It's distasteful to jump to insults as a whole. And I have the right to call you out on it if that's my opinion.

author: Lumorniel Sycamore
comment: @Canadian-Rain First of all, why would I not reply if I want to make this a discussion? I don't understand your issue. If I wanna open a discussion I should be free to. Second of all as a woman myself. I think there's nothing wrong with finding a woman aesthetically pleasing I just think it's incredibly distateful to just ignore the whole story and comment on a woman's beauty like that and I'm allowed to say that if that's my opinion.

author: Canadian-Rain
comment: @Lumorniel Sycamore Why are you even replying to the guy's comment if you want to make this a discussion? Speaking as a woman, there's nothing wrong with finding a woman aesthetically pleasing. Even if you're missing some context. Particularly when their beauty is a key feature of both her mother and her abilities pre-magic loss. Means the animators did their job.
